intro: Trichinium burtonii, commonly known as the Burtons' trichium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Trichinium burtonii is primarily of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
